required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Arterial Elasticity: A Substudy of Strategic Timing of AntiRetroviral Treatment (START)
clinical_study.official_title: Arterial Elasticity: A Substudy of Strategic Timing of AntiRetroviral Treatment (START)

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find out if starting anti-retroviral therapy (ART) above 500 cluster-of-differentiation-4 (CD4)+ cells/milliliter (mL) ('early ART group') is better at reducing the stiffness of arteries than waiting to start ART until the CD4+ drops below 350 cells/mL ('deferred ART group'). Artery stiffness has been associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular (heart) disease, and could be useful as an earlier indicator of heart disease. In this study, the stiffness of arteries will be measured at study entry, months 4, 8, 12, and annually thereafter, using a tonometer on the participant's forearm.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in large artery elasticity (LAE
primary_outcome.description: Large artery elasticity is measured using a tonometer placed on the forearm.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in small artery elasticity (SAE)
primary_outcome.description: Small artery elasticity is measured using a tonometer placed on the forearm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in plasma markers of thrombosis and fibrinolysis
secondary_outcome.description: Citrated plasma will be collected and stored for central measurement of plasma markers of thrombosis and fibrinolysis in the future.

biospec_descr.textblock: Citrated plasma is collected at each study visit and stored at a central lab for future assessment of changes in plasma markers of thrombosis and fibrinolysis.

study_pop.textblock: Enrollees are HIV-positive, antiretroviral-naive individuals with CD4+ > 500 cells/mL randomized to the START trial.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Simultaneous co-enrollment in the START study
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to ascertain waveform measurements that can be analyzed, i.e. atrial fibrillation

overall_official.affiliation: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute
University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

link.description: INSIGHT network website, including information on the START Arterial Elasticity Substudy
